newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon t-bill auction raises 244.9 bln pounds.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon t-bill auction raises 244.9 bln pounds.

text.p: Lebanon's weekly treasury bill issue of June 12 raised 244.9 billion Lebanese pounds, according to finance ministry results issued on Monday.
The previous issue raised 250.3 billion pounds.
The latest issue raised the following amounts (in billion of pounds, previous week in brackets):

The central bank said three percent of all competitive bids -- those made by Lebanese institutions -- were accepted up to the discount rate and yield for three-month bills and 10 percent for six-month bills and one-year bills.
All competitive bids were accepted for the two-year bills.

The bank restricted the acceptance of non-competitive bids -- those made by private individuals and foreign investors -- for the shorter-term bills, approving three percent up to the discount rate and yield for three-month bills and 10 percent for six-month bills.
All non-competitive bids were approved for one-year and two-year bills, it said.
The Lebanese pound closed at 1,540.75 to the U.S. dollar on Monday from 1,541.25 a week earlier and 1,573 a year ago.
